content:
Has anyone attempted to formalize classification results for low-dimensional Lie algebras?
I know that the classification of semisimple Lie algebras is an ongoing project, but has anyone worked on other types of Lie algebras?
A few people here at Unicamp are currently trying to tackle this. We have already proved the classification of 2-dimensional Lie algebras (there's just two: the abelian one and the affine one, so far over arbitrary fields). It's not yet mathlib-ready, but we are definitely considering to contribute eventually.
I don't think anyone has worked on this, I look forward to seeing your contribution when it is ready.

Note that the semisimple classification is barely being worked on (partly as I got involved in other work). I do hope to return to it at some point next year as a large amount of the theory is in place. If you wish to contribute there, a self-contained piece is #10066 (albeit, not an easy task for a beginner).
Thanks for the heads up, that's good to know! When we have something to show, I will post it here.

So, just wanted to bump this here: we made some progress!
#announce > Classification results for Lie algebras
Next step is to start preparing some pull requests to mathlib. We haven't done this before, and as a warm-up we thought we could start with the following, relatively isolated theorem:

variable {R L : Type*} [CommRing R] [LieRing L] [LieAlgebra R L]

theorem solvable_of_ideal_and_quot_solvable {I : LieIdeal R L}
      (quotsol : LieAlgebra.IsSolvable (L â§¸ I)) (Isol : LieAlgebra.IsSolvable I) :
    LieAlgebra.IsSolvable L := sorry

Anyone is welcome to look at our code and make suggestions; we are aware that we still have to change it a bit to match the mathlib conventions.
